logic

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Game contains all elements necessary for the game

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String configFile
      path to the configuration file, with information on board dimension and types of ships
      private static Game instance
      unique instance of a game
      private int numberPlayers
      number of human players of the game (1 or 2)
      private Player player1
      player 1 - always human
      private java.lang.String player1File
      path to the save file of player 1, where all relevant player info is stored
      private Player player2
      player 2 - may be human or not
      private java.lang.String player2File
      path to the save file of player 1, where all relevant player info is stored
      private int startingPlayer
      randomly determined player that gets the first turn (1 or 2)
      private int state
      state of the game - 0 if not finished, 1 if player 1 wins, 2 if player 2 wins

      • readConfig

        public void readConfig()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the game specifications (board size and properties of the ships) from the configuration
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is some problem with the configuration file

      • loadConfig

        public void loadConfig()
        Loads the base game specifications when reading the configuration file fails

      • validateConfig

        public int validateConfig()
        Validates the game specifications: board size, space occupied by the ships and different symbols for different ship types
        Returns:
        int: 0 - valid configuration 1 - board to big (more than 26 cells horizontally or vertically) 2 - board to small (space occupied by all ships cells greater than double of board cells) 3 - different type ships with the same symbol

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Initiates the board for the opponents for each player, where bomb results will be registered

      • computeState

        public void computeState()
        Computes the state of the game, that is, if some player has won and which one

      • printPlayer

        public java.lang.String printPlayer(int playerNumber)
        Prints the player with the given number
        Parameters:
        playerNumber - number of the player we want to print (1 or 2)
        Returns:
        string with the result of the print

      • printPlayer

        public java.lang.String printPlayer(Player playerA,
                                    Player playerB)
        Prints a given player as well as the opponents board as viewed by the player
        Parameters:
        playerA - player we want to print
        playerB - opponent of the player we want to print
        Returns:
        string with the players board and their idea of the opponents board

      • changeShipPosition

        public boolean changeShipPosition(int playerNumber,
                                  Position oldPos,
                                  Position newPos,
                                  boolean newOri)
        Tries to change the position of a ship of a given player
        Parameters:
        playerNumber - number of the player whose ship we want to move
        oldPos - position of the ship we want to move
        newPos - position where we want to place the ship
        newOri - orientation we wish for the ship
        Returns:
        true if the change is successful, false otherwise

        shipIndex - index of the ship in the vector of player's ships

      • manualPlaceShip

        public boolean manualPlaceShip(int playerNumber,
                               int shipIndex,
                               Position position,
                               boolean orientation)
        Tries to determine a given player's ship position and orientation
        Parameters:
        playerNumber - number of the player whose ship we want to place
        shipIndex - index of the ship in the player's vector
        position - position where we want to place the ship
        orientation - orientation we want for the ship
        Returns:
        true if it is possible to place the ship in the given position and orientation, false otherwise
